par.text: Americium is a silvery-white, malleable metal. It is one of the transuranic elements - the artificially prepared elements with atomic numbers higher than 92. All its isotopes are radioactive. The most stable isotope is

half-life of 7000 years. Americium was artificially obtained by a team of American researchers directed by Glenn T. Seaborg in1944. The name is derived from the name of the continent. Americium is a hazardous element, because of its high radioactivity and its ability to accumulate in bone tissue. Its most important compound is americium(IV) oxide – Am
, used for the preparation of other americium compounds.
